newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS -- Issues to watch - March 21.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS -- Issues to watch - March 21.

text.p: * Shares in Philip Morris Cos Inc, having lost 6-1/8 to 115-7/8 in New York Thursday, were quoted at 116-1/4 in London overnight. RJR Nabisco Holdings Corp bounced 1/4 in London to 41-7/8 after falling 5/8 in New York.

* Olicom A/S said it would buy CrossComm Corp, paying $5.00, 0.2667 Olicom share and a three-year warrant for each of CrossComm's 9.3 million shares. Olicom closed at 14-3/7 in New York while CrossComm closed at 8-5/8.
* Dow Jones & Co Inc's Wall Street Journal was hit Thursday with the largest libel award in U.S. history -- $222.7 million. Shares closed at 42-1/4.

* First Merchants Acceptance Corp said Thursday it expected to report a "break-even" first quarter. Analysts had expected the company to earn $0.42 per share, according to First Call's consensus estimate. Shares closed at 10-7/8.
